S. Korean Students Protest against Troop Dispatch 
    Pyongyang, August 31 (KCNA) -- At least 100 students of Seoul National University and Korea University affiliated to the South Korean Federation of University Student Councils staged a demonstration in front of Seoul Airport in Songnam, Kyonggi Province on August 28 in protest against the dispatch of "Jaitun" unit to Iraq, according to the south Korean "KBS".
 The protesters strongly demanded the authorities cancel the decision to send more troops to Iraq, stating that the unjustifiable dispatch of troops is little short of reducing all the people to war criminals.

articles.content:
Greetings to Libyan Leader
    Pyongyang, August 31 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, today sent a message of greetings to Colonel Moammer el Gaddafi, leader of the great September first revolution in the Great Socialist People's Libyan Arab Jamahiriya, on the occasion of the 35th anniversary of the great September first revolution in Libya.
 The message expressed the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would continue to grow stronger and wished the Libyan people progress and prosperity.

articles.title: Greetings to President of Uzbekistan
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets Kyrgyz President
    Pyongyang, August 31 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greetings to Askar Akayev, president of the Kyrgyz Republic, on Aug. 31 on the occasion of its national day.
 The message wished the president success in his work for the prosperity of the country and the wellbeing of the people, expressing the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would continue to develop in the interests of the two peoples.

articles.content:
Greetings to President of Uzbekistan
    Pyongyang, August 31 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, sent a message of greetings to Islam Karimov, president of Uzbekistan, on August 31 on the occasion of the 13th anniversary of the independence of the country.
 Wishing the president greater success in his work for stability and prosperity of the country, the message expressed the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would further develop.
